list_definition.definition: a general name for several types of singing-bird, especially the skylark, which flies high into the air as it sings.
a piece of fun or mischief

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She said she had done it just for a lark.

list_ex_of_english: It is for the county council in the first instance to consider whether larks need protection, during the open season.
By ' a world of nightingales and larks and deer ' presumably he means a world containing such things and lacking humans.
That was considered to be a bit of a lark and it is now potentially a criminal offence.
I know of no place where you hear the lark better than in the areas where our coal pits are situated.
One cannot expect a raven to hatch a lark.
Afterwards he claimed that he stood under that title for a lark.
It might refer to starlings and larks, as well as to other things.
It has been said the collier likes to hear the lark sing.
